item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @apocalypsePK apocalypsePK
item.description:
@apocalypsePK wrote:

ok first of all utorrent is the most unstable way to portforward and the most easyiest it will probally crash within 30 mins to an hour my advice is look on your router on the front or back it will say a number like mine is smc8014w-g so go to portforward.com and click router list ctrl f type ur router code and click find once you find it click it then it will bring you down to a game list find runescape private server click it and it will show everything step by step

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @lil_wayne612 lil wayne612
item.description:
@lil_wayne612 wrote:

Okay Try this, go to start>run>CMD> then type in “ipconfig” get your default gateway and the last three digits of your ip address . Then open up your internet browser and type in your default gateway, example, 192.168.1.1, then Go to game and applications then For the name of your thing put in “RSPS” and end and start port is “43594” and in the last box put in the last three digits of your ip, (you may have already done that and this upcoming one) so if youve already done that, make sure you go to start>control panel>security center>windows firewall>exceptions> make sure youve added it into there, if not click add then put in your seveers name and the port is 43594, make sure on uturennt or w.e youve set it to connect to 43594.

Thanks!

P.S to turn it on you need a no-ip.

Read full topic
